pages.text: Lebachacanthus was a xenacanthid shark from the Permian period. It was a freshwater animal which lived in swamps and bogs and preyed upon amphibians and small fish. It was originally classified as a species of Orthacanthus but was later moved to its own species and it now belongs to a separate family. The fin spines in females were longer than those in males.
